titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Inapunch real estate collection 1986.035
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:59 +0000.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn City Railroad Co. (New York, N.Y.)

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn City and Newtown Railroad Company

did.abstract: The Inapunch real estate collection measures 0.2 linear feet and spans the period 1909 to 1929. The collection contains correspondence, bonds, and insurance policies of the Onslow-Moore Company, a land developing company based on Court Street in Brooklyn Heights. Also included are stock certificates for Brooklyn City and Newtown Railroad Company and Brooklyn City Rail Company, and an insurance policy for Morgenstern & Company.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Inapunch real estate collection, 1986.035, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
